title: Opening Hextech tab = Immediate disconnect, please help! same problem for 2 weeks now!
body:
The chest opening has only worked for me 1 or 2 times and now it doesnt work at all. when i click on the hextech tab i got the inventory and at that moment i am disconnected and have to close my client cause nothing works.. I have repaired my client 6!!! times and completely uninstalled it and installed it again an hour ago and the same problem is occuring.

I am pretty fed up i have been searching everywhere, youtube and google for a solution even tried asking others if they have had this problem and asking them what i should do but noone seems to know or care.

please help have had this issue for 2 weeks.

replies.body:
Hey there,

Could you try the steps outlined [here](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761944#wq7), let me know if this helps.
Didnt help my settings were already like that.

Hi,

Just popping in to say I'm having the exact same issue. My IE settings were already set up as above and I reinstalled Adobe AIR with no fix. :(

Any help would be appreciated, ty!

We're trying to narrow down this issue now, it seems to be affecting a decent amount of players.

* What antivirus are you using?
* Could you try temporarily disabling your AV and seeing if the issue persists?

Hi,

I'm using Windows Defender. After disabling windows defender I still get disconnected when attempting to open my hextech chest. :(

UPDATE: Not sure if this helps, but I just attempted to open my hextech chest on my girlfriend's computer (same house, same network) and still got disconnected. Even tested it with a different modem / router (just in case, yknow) but same issue.
sooo there's no answer to this yet -.-?

The issue seems to be caused by a process server side that handles hextech crafting. The process seems to halt all account functionality while the hextech service processes. This process lasts roughly 5 minutes for me, during which my account becomes completely unresponsive and I can't even login (which is why I know it's server side).
still got this problem... funny how riots working on fixes when there rp system isnt working but when its something like this they dont give a fuck..

We're trying to narrow down this issue now, it seems to be affecting a decent amount of players.

* What antivirus are you using?
* Could you try temporarily disabling your AV and seeing if the issue persists?
